dt-option.name: titleRow
dt-option.summary: Control which row in the header is the title row
dt-option.description:
This option can be used to control how DataTables which cells in a table header are treated as a "title cell".
Title cells are used for the following in DataTables:
* Indicate the ordering status of its column(s) (`-init ordering.indicators) * Have a click / return key listener on them to activate ordering (`-init ordering.handler`) * Column titles (`-init columns.title` and `-api column().title()`).
You can give this option as one of several values:
* A `-type number` - this will specify the row index in the header that is used for the above. * `true` - the cells in the top row (index 0) will be used for the title cells * `false` - the cells in the bottom row will be used for the title cells * `null` (default) - all cells will be used for ordering operations, and the first unique cell (i.e. colspan=1) will be used for the column title.
